title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., Washington Commanders DE, suffered a season-ending left quad injury against the Packers.
Wise, 31, injured his leg during a blocked extra point attempt and will require surgery, per ESPN.
Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is likely to pitch against the Athletics in Boston's rotation next week at Fenway Park.
Alex Cora affirmed Early's role following his debut, along with Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison's potential starts.
Final decision on Red Sox pitching lineup, including Early, will be made by Sunday, per Cora and staff discussions.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman's agent Scott Boras will decide on contract opt-out after 2025 season.
Bregman, 31, signed a three-year, $120 million contract with an opt-out after 2025 and 2026.
Sam Kennedy stated Bregman wants to stay in Boston; Jeff Passan predicts Bregman will opt out.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Misery' starring Kathy Bates is streaming on HBO Max, aligning with Stephen King's 'The Long Walk' theatrical release.
'This Is Spinal Tap' streams on Xumo, coinciding with its sequel, extending the mockumentary genre's legacy.
'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 with Selena Gomez, Martin Short, and Steve Martin is now on Hulu.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White are out for Sunday's game against the Miami Dolphins.
Gonzalez has been absent since July due to a hamstring injury; White is sidelined with an illness.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and offensive tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for Sunday's game in Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins as DC Terrell Williams remains away.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel expressed confidence in Kuhr's preparation for the game amid Williams's absence.
Kuhr, in his first year as inside linebackers coach, has prior coaching experience with Ohio State and the Titans.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges, weeks before her trial's originally scheduled date.
The charges include conspiracy, wire fraud, and making false statements; Cannon-Grant faces a 27-count indictment.
Cannon-Grant and her late husband allegedly spent nonprofit funds on personal expenses, leading to multiple fraud indictments.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler James Robinson, 22, was arrested for allegedly shooting Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University.
Robinson, a third-year electrical apprenticeship student, had no prior criminal record and is politically unaffiliated.
Family members said Robinson recently became more political, seeing Kirk as spreading hate, leading to the alleged attack.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox and Yankees are competing for the top wild-card spot, with New York holding a slight advantage.
Boston leads the season series against the Yankees 8-2, dominating recent matchups with strong pitching performances.
Trevor Story leads the Red Sox offense with a .308 average since Roman Anthony's injury, while the Yankees rely on home runs.

title: Winthrop loses $1.2M in climate grants over MBTA Communities Act noncompliance
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Winthrop loses $1.2M in climate grants for failing to comply with MBTA Communities Act.
Noncompliance affects flood mitigation projects in Morton and Fisherman's Bend neighborhoods.
Town Council's 4-4 vote failed to adopt zoning changes, impacting grants eligibility.
